"Kyle, what the hell?" Catherine shouts, her voice shrill.

"Jen? What are you talking about, Kyle?" Catherine's voice is edging on anger now.

Catherine just stares at you. So you lift your hand--decorated with Catherine's bracelet and rings, and tipped with long, red fingernails--and point at the rear view mirror. Catherine looks into the mirror, spots your reflection, and mutters, "Oh my God..."

"I don't know how it happened, Cathy," you say. "It should be impossible. Things like this... don't happen, right? But... here we are. Somehow I have the power to switch lives with people. Right now anyone who came by would see me as you and you as me, just like you see in that mirror."

For the first time, Catherine cracks a smile, and then she laughs softly. So do you.

"But Cathy," you say, taking her hands. "Something must have happened when I switched with Jen. We must have... crossed wires or something. We switched back to our own lives, but we must have retained pieces of each other. Up here." You tap your forehead. "Because I haven't felt right since we switched back. Everything has just felt... wrong all day. It's a horrible feeling. And I've finally realized that it's because I want to be a girl again. I need to be a girl again. I don't think I'm ever going to be able to be happy again as a guy. But Cathy... I don't want to give you up. I don't know that I can ask you to be a lesbian, but... I want whatever support you can give me. Please."

Catherine looks at you a long time. Then at the mirror. Then out the window. She's silent for several minutes. Then, at last, she looks back at you and says,

122212112.content:
People bustle around you, oblivious to the boy in the skirt standing among them. You're standing in a store, your hand holding a black candle a couple of inches beneath your nose. A strong smell of lavender drifts up from your hand. The store is dimly-lit and decorated heavily with dark and morbid imagery... it looks to be some sort of goth specialty store. A boy with heavy black makeup and black leather clothing meets your eyes as they pass over him, and for a second you panic; but then he looks back down at the book in his hands.

You take a closer inventory of your outfit. Tight black t-shirt with a skull design; short black skirt. You feel a little awkward and exposed wearing a skirt, though you realize you probably shouldn't, since you've been dressed as a girl all day and you know from Jennifer's dance recital that no one sees you as a guy right now. Chunky black platform sneakers... they look heavy, but not too difficult to trudge around in. Fishnet stockings, with big rips in several places. Fingerless fishnet gloves and black painted fingernails. An ankh necklace dangles from your neck. A black purse hangs over your shoulder to complete the look.

Looking back to the full-length mirror in front of you, you see a petite girl dressed in the same outfit. She looks to be a little older than you--you're guessing she's in college--and she's slender and much shorter than you. She can't be more than an inch over five feet tall, which makes her even shorter than Jennifer... for a moment, you wonder how you can possibly fit in her clothing... but that's the least odd thing about this situation, so you brush it aside.

In addition to what you saw looking down, you see your reflection has several earrings in both ears, as well as an eyebrow piercing and a small stud in her nose. Lifting your free hand--and watching the girl in the mirror do the same--you feel the same piercings in your nose and eyebrow. Your lips are a deep shape of black, and your eyes are lined with thick black makeup... kohl, you realize, though you have no idea how you know that. Your hair is black, with purple highlights. All in all, although you're not at all into goth girls, you have to admit, you're pretty cute... err, or your reflection is. The girl you've become is attractive, and her goth getup does little to take away from that.

Acting on a sudden thought, you open your purse and pullout a dainty black billfold... you knew exactly where to find it, although again, you're not quite sure how you knew. Pulling out the first card, you see it's a student ID for... Wyoming State University? You choke for a second... you don't live anywhere near Wyoming! This time you didn't just jump into a different body... you leapt halfway across the country! How could that be possible? Then again, how could any of this be possible?

You try to shake off the shock and zone in instead on the bit of information you were looking for: your new name. You're... Cassandra Mayer now. Cassandra, you think as you look back at your pretty reflection... it fits. Mythological doomed prophetess... seems very goth. (Wait, you can barely remember which goddesss is Athena and which is Aphrodite... how do you know that?)

Frowning down at your skirt, you realize you're going to have to odeal with the whole girl thing. You never wanted to be a girl. When you wished for Jennifer's life, you were thinking about her popularity, her athleticness, her closeness with your girlfriend, her parents... you didn't mean you wanted to prance around in skirts and makeup. When you were Jennifer, you were able to kind of ignore the whole thing... you spent most of the day scouring the internet, trying to find any clue that might explain how on earth you could have switched lives with someone else. You didn't find much... just a bunch of Quantum Leap fanfiction and new age sites and some freaky interactive stories on some writing community site. Nothing with real answers. You went back to sleep for a couple of hours, too, with the hope that you would wake up back in your own life... or better yet, that you would wake up and realize it had all been a dream. And, err, you snopped through Catherine's room for a little while. Hey, you're no saint.

But you DIDN'T spend any particular time gawking at Jennifer's body. You didn't try on her clothing or experiment with her makeup. You couldn't ignore your situation, but you tried to ignore the fact that you were a girl. That was easier given the fact that you spent most of the day alone in Jennifer's house rather than at school. When you changed out of her boyish pajamas and into her dance tights, and when you went to her dance class and mingled with the other girls there, you had to think a little more about your newly-changed gender, but even then, for the most part, you just surrendered to Jennifer's instincts and memories and focused on trying to get your dancing right.

But now you've jumped into another life. Another GIRL'S life. If this is going to keep happening--if you're going to keep jumping around from body to body--you can't just ignore it... you're going to have to deal with living as a girl, dressing as a girl, acting as a girl, being a girl around other people. You're going to have to figure out HOW to be a girl. And you have to get over the embarassment you're feeling right know standing around in public in girls' clothing. And you're going to have to get over it soon if you're going to get through this...

1222121121.content:
You place the black candle back on the shelf from which Cassandra apparently took it and head out of the store and into an open-air street. Dusk gathers in the sky; in the fading light, you see you're in what appears to be a modest-sized shopping district with a fair amount of pedestrian traffic... probably this city's downtown. People pass by the numerous storefronts at a steady pace; you note a roughly equal mixture of college students and older people, many of the latter with children.

Some distance down the street, you see a large cluster of multistory builidings; and suddenly you realize that that is the college, and that you live on campus in the dorms. A sort of mental map to Cassandra's dorm room forms in your mind; grateful for the help, you begin to follow it.

This knowledge that's been seeping into your mind, first from Jennifer and now from Cassandra... it's strange. It seems so random... you knew the names of some of Jennifer's friends in her dance class, but not the name of others of them. You "remembered" her dance moves, but you didn't know, for example, her e-mail password or the location of anything in her room. You know the location of Cassandra's dorm room and the name of the makeup around her eyes, but you didn't know her name or where she lievd without looking at her student ID. And much of the information you picked up from Jennifer is already gone; you remember your time in Jennifer's life clearly, but try as you might, you can't remember any of her dance moves. Those skills have disappeared as thoroughly as they came to you. And on top of all of that, you're not quite sure where all this random information is coming from. You're just glad it's coming, and you hope it keeps up.

As you walk, you're struck by a number of unusual sensations. The weight of your heavy shoes. The pinch of your fishnets. The tightness of your skirt around your hips, and the airy feeling around your thighs and pelvis as the cool evening air drifts up your skirt. The discomfort of the thong you're wearing as it attempts to lodge itself tighter and deeper into your nether regions. The tightness of your bra around your chest and shoulders. The shifting of your ankh necklace as it hangs from your neck. The smell of your makeup and the taste of your lipstick. And your height! The lift of your shoes makes you feel several inches taller... you know that, even with them, you can't be any taller than 5'3" from everyone else's perspective, but from your perspective, you feel like a giant lumbering clumsily down the street.

You begin to notice something else as well... something odd in the eyes of the people walking past you in the opposite direction. Most of them are polite enough, but notice a number of people staring at you as you pass them, while others avert their eyes. You notice it in the older townies and the young children especially, though you get it from a few of the teenagers and college-aged people as well. Some of them look curious, some uncomfortable, some disapproving... a few even look at you with a kind of mocking superiority. You hear one little girl say as she passes you, "Mommy, why is that lady dressed like that?" Another mother gently pushes her young child away from you.

Is this what it's like to feel like an outcast? You've never been the most popular guy, but you've never felt overtly shunned, either. Most people have always just ignored you. But right now--even though, again, it's only a minority of people who are reacting to your appearance--you feel like the center of attention, and you don't like it.

It's a little surprising... you remember Cassandra's appearance, and it seemed pretty mild as far as goths go. On the other hand, this is Wyoming. Wyoming strikes you as a pretty coniservative place... maybe people here simply aren't used to people who look like you do right now.

You also wonder, absently, if your body language could be part of the problem. After all, you're still walking like a guy, moving like a guy. You make a note to yourself to try to cultivate a more feminine walk as soon as you can.

There's another reaction you're seeing in the eyes of some of the passersby... some of the men, specifically. They're smiling at you, eyeing you up and down, leering at you. You're a pretty girl, after all, once you get past the piercings and the makeup. For some of these guys, the piercings and makeup are probably even a turn-on. The leering makes you feel even more uneasy than the sneering, and so you lower your eyes, pick up your pace, and resolve to get to Cassandra's dorm room as quickly as you can.

If you still had any doubts, they would have been expelled by the big sign hanging on the door that says "Cassandra & Shelly" in large, friendly letters. There are a few pictures taped around the sign, but a closer look at them shows that most of them have been defaced: the pictures are marked up with moustaches and devil horns and words like "loser" and "fatty". There's some poetry taped to the door as well, but it's all been scribbed out by a pen; you can't read the poems, but you can make out, on some of them, the words "By Cassandra Mayer. Even the sign isn't untouched, you notice as you look closely... there are a few words written beneath the name Cassandra, like "devil worshipper" and "whore", while there are arrows pointing at Shelly's name that read "drama queen" and "bitch". The door looks like a war zone; suddenly you're a little nervous about going inside.

Opening the door gently, you look inside and see a cramped dorm room with two beds, two desks, two dressers, and a television. A blonde girl wearing a short-sleeved blouse and ankle-length dress sits curled up on one of the beds, a book in her lap. This must be Shelly, you think. The sun shines warmly on your face, coaxing you from confused dreams about your girlfriend helping you to pick out a tutu for your big dance recital, about dancing in a goth club with friends you've never met before but known for years, about worrying how your family will react when they find out you're in love with a girl.

The scent of lavendar tickles your nose, and the warm feeling of a soft body intertwined with yours makes you want to sleep forever. But something nags at you, some memory you can't quite place. Something about Catherine... something about Jennifer... something about Cassandra...

Cassandra. Jennifer. It comes back to you. Your long, confusing day comes back to you all at once, and suddenly, you're awake.

It was a dream, right? It had to be a dream. Real people in real life don't wake up in someone else's bed looking at someone else's reflection in the mirror. It was a dream.
But then you remember that you went to sleep alone last night. And as lavendar perfume and a warm body at your side tug at your awareness, you know something's wrong.

Opening your eyes, you find yourself in an unfamiliar room, the walls of which are painted in soft rose and decorated with bright landscapes. You blink to shake the sleep from your eyes, then turn to look at the person lying next to you. You're relieved to find it's a woman, which means you must be a man this time. You sigh in relief.

But as you sit up to get a better look at the woman and the blanket slides from over you, you see you're wearing a pink silk camisole, shiny in the morning light, and realize you're very wrong. Pulling the blankets off a little more, you see that you're dressed in the camisole, a matching pair of pink silk panties, and nothing more. Shoulder-length hair brushes against your neck and falls in your eyes. And your legs, you notice, are still shaved clean. That leaves two possiblities: either you're a woman again, or you're a crossdresser. Neither one is very appealing.

As you move, the woman next to you stirs. She's lovely, you realize: a beauty in her mid 20s, with a soft face, a lithe body, and a warm tan. Her dark hair is cut in a short pixie cut. She opens her eyes and smiles. "Morning, beautiful," she says groggily.

"Good morning," you say, tentatively. You're a woman, and she's a woman... does that mean you're a lesbian?

The woman turns to the nightstand on her other side and looks at the alarm clock. "Shit, we overslept." She runs a hand over her face. "I need to get ready for work. I've already been late two days this week." She hurredly gets out of bed, and you see she's dressed in a t-shirt and pajama pants. Leaning down, she kisses you lovingly but briefly on the lips. "You go ahead and sleep if you'd like; I know you were up late last night getting ready. I'll see you tonight at your show." And then she hurries out of the room.

Show? What show? Are you an actress or a singer or something? Jeeze, you'd better hope you get some memories of your latest life the same way you did as Jennifer and Cassandra, or otherwise, you're screwed.

As you sit up further, you catch movement in the corner of your eye. Standing up, you find yourself looking into a full-length mirror. A slender, petite brunette woman of about 25 looks back at you, dressed in the same camisole and panties you're wearing. The woman in the mirror is sweet-faced and adorable, with creamy skin and a body any woman would be happy to have. She and her girlfriend--because it's clear to you by now that they're definitely girlfriends--must make a lovely couple.

Taking a look around the rest of your room, which is decorated in a tasteful and very feminine manner, you spot something that clues you in to the nature of the "show" the other woman mentioned. It's...

1222121121112222121.content:
The sun shines warmly on your face, coaxing you from confused dreams about your girlfriend helping you to pick out a tutu for your big dance recital, about dancing in a goth club with friends you've never met before but known for years, about wearing a fluffy white dress and marrying the man you love.

You groan as your eyes flutter open. Your head's a mess, and you know there's something important you should be remembering. But the sun is so nice and warm, and the arms wrapped around you so firm and comforting, that you don't want to wake up and lose this moment.

Wait, arms? You're in someone's arms? How is that possible? When you went to bed last night, you were... wait, where were you? You should have been in yoru bed at home, but you remember purple sheets and an irritible roommate...

Then suddenly you remember it. Everything. Your wish, waking up as Jennifer, going to sleep as Cassandra...

But this isn't Cassandra's room. It looks more like a nice hotel room, you think, peering around at the spartan wood decorations, at the paintings of flowers on the wall. All at once, you realize you've switched again, and you groan once more, louder this time.

And that's when you remember the warm body lying with its arms wrapped gently around you, because it stirs at the sound of your voice. You turn, breathless, and see, to your alarm, that you're lying next to a man!

A very handsome man, you think absently. Dark hair, strong features, a fit body nestled between haphazard sheets. A strange feeling rises in the pit of your stomach.

You sit up, trying to disentangle yourself from the man's arms, only to realize, to your further alarm, that you're completely naked. As you move, the man, who was already on the verge of waking, opens his eyes and smiles up at you.

"Am I in heaven?" he says, in a warm baritone that stirs a strange feeling in the back of your mind.

"Huh?" you ask, your head spinning.

"I'm in Hawaii, I'm on my honeymoon, and I'm married to the most beautiful woman in the world," he says, running a palm over your cheek. "I can't imagine a heaven better than this."

You blush, and your heart flutters at the man's words. And suddenly you realize, with a mix of pleasure and alarm, that you're incredibly attracted to this man. You've never had any gay thoughts. Ever. But this man is stirring feelings in you that are unmistakable. Is it your current host's thoughts spilling over into your own, the way you knew how to dance as Jennifer and how to get home as Cassandra?

As the man sits up and kisses you, you don't care what it is.

The sun shines warmly on your face, coaxing you from confused dreams about your girlfriend helping you to pick out a tutu for your big dance recital, about dancing in a goth club with friends you've never met before but known for years, about Justin Bieber asking you on stage to dance with him in front of a crowd of jealous fans.

You stare longingly into Justin's eyes for what feels like an eternity, until you suddenly realize that you can't stand Justin Bieber. Jeeze, did spending most of yesterday as Jennifer rub off on you that much? Maybe, now that you're Cassandra, you can get some cooler memories.

As you lie in bed, enjoying this last break before you plunge back into the mess you accidentally made for yourself with that stupid wish, you think over your options. You know you need to find out more about your situation if you want to get back to your old life. The internet's probably as good a place to start as any. Cassandra's in college, so you probably have access to a decent library, too. Cassandra's into all this goth stuff; maybe she even knows about some crazy magic shop you can check out. You've never believed in magic before, but now you don't really have any choice but to believe, do you?

When you sit up and open your eyes, though, all those plans come crashing down. Because, taking in the room around you, you realize you're not in Cassandra's room anymore. You must have switched again.

The walls of your latest room are painted a bright pink and covered in posters that make you cringe. Ponies, Twilight, and yes, Justin Bieber cover the walls in a frenzy of teen-girl fantasy. A girl AGAIN? Three in a row? You sincerely hope this is just a coincidence and not a sign of things to come.

Standing up, you catch a glimpse of your clothing. This time around you're wearing a baby blue t-shirt with a rainbow on it and a pair of white pajama shorts with pink stripes. Your fingernails and toenails are painted a pink that matches the color of your walls. As you frown at your clothing, you feel your lips scraping against something on your teeth and realize you're wearing braces, too. Great... at 18, you thought you were done with being a teenager.

You catch sight of a vanity table like the one in Catherine's room and go over to get a look at your latest reflection in the mirror. The girl looking back at you is younger than you'd expected; she can't be any older than twelve or thirteen. She has soft dirty-blonde hair and a pretty face, but she also has all the awkwardness and lankiness of her age.

Fantastic, you think. Being a high school girl would have been bad enough, but it looks like you're a middle schooler. You shudder at the thought of diving back into that social warzone. And as the opposite sex this time. Can't you go back to being your girlfriend's bratty little sister or a goth pariah?

122212112111222221111.content:
As you climb into the back seat of the car, you notice you're not alone there. A teenage girl, about fifteen years old, and pretty in a girl-next-door sort of way, shares the back seat with you. A teenage boy about eighteen years old, athletic-looking and wearing a letterman jacket, has shotgun, while your new mother, still looking impatient, sits in the driver's seat. Once you're in and you have your seat belt on, the car pulls out of the driveway and you're off.

"Hey, Ames," the teenage girl whispers, "Mom's really mad. You've got to stop running late like this. She's still pissed you've been cutting classes."

"I know," you whisper, processing this new information. Is Amy a young delinquent, or is there something else going on? You know plenty about ditching class with your stoner friends, but from Amy's room, her clothing, her face in the mirror, you'd kind of gotten the impression that she was more more of a goody-two-shoes.

"Here," the girl says, taking a brush from her backpack. "I know you didn't have much time to get ready, but your hair's a mess." She hands you the brush and a compact mirror, and you get to work brushing your hair. It's a new experience for you, brushing hair this long, but you do your best to fake it.

You didn't have much time to be picky with your outfit, so you didn't pay much attention to what you put on. Now that you have some time, you take a look. You're wearing a pink t-shirt and a pair of black leggings that go down to the bottom half of your shins, along with a pair of black ballet flats. It's a girlier outfit that you'd like, though you suppose it could be worse. Given Amy's wardrobe, you'd say your outfit is about as inoffensive to your masculinity as you could have picked. You hadn'd noticed the butterfly on the the front of your t-shirt; you cringe a little at that.

Studying Amy's reflection as best you can in the compact, you try to get a feel for her. She's pretty, though she's awkward in that uniquely tweenish way: skinny, long limbs, barely-there breasts. The braces complete the look. She reminds you a little of Jennifer a couple of years ago. She'll be a hottie in a couple of years, but for now, she just looks like any other girl caught in the awkward no-woman's-land between childhood and adolescence.

You hope, for her sake and for yours, that Amy is at least reasonably popular at her school. From the feeling you're getting, it could go either way. Middle school is a warzone; you don't know anyone who survived those tender years without taking a few bullets. And as bad as it was for you, you know from Catherine and Jennifer's stories that girls have it even worse. They're just beginning to develop their social hierarchy and learning to compete with each other. Combined with the volatile emotions of early adolescence, it makes for a lot of insecurity, pettiness, jealousy, and backstabbing. Can you, at the upper end of adolescence, and a boy, and not particularly invested in Amy's life yet, rise above it, or will you get wrapped up in all of that too?

As you finish comibiing your hair and hand the brush and mirror back to "your" sister, you start to realize that you haven't recognized any landmarks from the drive so far. Sure, you don't know every little block and back street of your neighborhood, but shouldn't you have seen something that looks familiar, at least? You're beginning to fear that you're not just in a different demographic from everyone you know, but in an entirely different town. You should have been expecting that, you suppose... When you were Cassandra, you were in an entirely different state. Maybe you just got lucky when your first swap landed you in the same down and a familiar life. What if you keep hopping all over the country? Or into other countries? Or even onto different continents?

At last, the car pulls into a school parking lot. From the age of the students walking around, you suspect this is your school and not the high school your older siblings must go to. (How strange to think of the girl sitting next to you, who is a few years young to you, as your older sister. But you're clearly the baby of the family.) You've managed to survive the entire drive without being pressed to talk too much; your mother and siblings were too busy talking amongst themselves. And besides, there was definitely a chill between you and Amy's mother. As you head into school, though, you doubt your luck will hold up. So far you really haven't had to interact much as a girl. As Jennifer, you were home alone most of the day, and as Cassandra, you spend most of your time walking back to your dorm room and reading alone. How well will you be able to fake it when Amy's friends try to talk to you?

Once you've said your goodbyes to your new family and they've pulled away, you realize you're about to find out. As you approach the school, a group of pretty, well-dressed, and clearly popular girls sees you and starts walking toward you. But are they Amy's friends, or do they have something else in mind?

15111.content:
With a long, lazy yawn, you stretch out your arms and blink groggily a few times. Your room is still just a bleary-eyed blur of dim light and muted colors at this point. Growling sleepily, like a bear stirring from hibernation, you roll out of bed, stand up, and take a step towards the door …

… and run smack into a wall!

“God dammit!” you grumble while massaging the pain from your nose.

Again you blink a few times, now also rubbing the sleep from your eyes with the palms of your hands. As the room slowly swirls into focus, you discover the reason you just walked into a wall.

This isn't your room.

Where normally you could roll out of the left side of your bed and easily walk to the door, this strange new room has the bed almost flush against a wall on the left side. You should have gotten out of the right side of the bed to walk to the door.

“Where the hell am I?” you mumble.

You begin to examine your surroundings more carefully now. The bedsheets are all blood red, as are the curtains. The walls are plastered with a dozen, cockeyed, slanted posters of various goth and metal bands. A laundry hamper of dirty clothes (all black) sits in one corner of the room. A dresser in another corner of the room is festooned with peeling stickers advertising the logos of all these goth and metal bands. Sitting atop the dresser is a cluttered collection of weird knickknacks: a plastic replica of a human skull, a Barbie doll clad in miniature goth attire, a statue of a crumbling medieval castle with a clock set in the middle of it, and a pair of gargoyle bookends flanking either end of a small parade of paranormal romance paperbacks.

Finally, with a sinking sensation of impending doom, you look down at yourself.

Your normal, eighteen-year old, male body is now squeezed into a tiny, black camisole top with lace trim. You're also wearing a pair of matching black, lacy panties.

Furthermore, your normally hairy legs have now been shaved smooth, and your toenails have been decorated with a uniform coat of glossy, jet black polish. A moment later you realize your fingernails are painted that same shade. And your hair feels different … longer, perhaps?

You grab blindly at your head and, sure enough, come away clutching a handful of dark, black, shoulder length hair that now tugs painfully at your scalp.

Glancing about the room, you spot a small, wall-mounted mirror near the door. Fearful of what you'll find yet unable to resist curiosity, you step towards the mirror … and gasp in awe.

There is the reflection of Zoe Featherstone, the short, pale goth girl you foolishly wished to trade lives with last night.

“Why did I wish for Zoe's life?” you moan. Bizarrely, Zoe's reflection in the mirror perfectly mimics your actions.

Of course your question is purely rhetorical. You made that idle wish last night because, in spite of her dark interest in macabrely weird fashion, Zoe was both a straight A brainiac as well as a remarkably athletic person. For someone who hated organized sports and had zero school spirit, she excelled in the mandatory gym class she took, often out-competing cheerleaders and girls who played on the basketball team. And although the teachers were all suspicious of her subversive appearance and counter-culture style, Zoe was always acing tests, never missed a homework assignment, and always seemed to know the right answer whenever a teacher called on her.

In comparison to your own dismal life of repeated failures, both at home and at school, Zoe Featherstone was an unmitigated success. For a “weird chick,” she still seemed to somehow have it all!

And now, because of your dumb wish, you had everything that once belonged to Zoe: her room, her clothes … presumably her entire life. Her friends, family, and everything.

“What do I do now?” you wonder aloud.

But I'm guessing that after a few months, the new and improved Kyle Drake will be a big success … and the pathetic new Zoe Featherstone will have let her life slide into the mess of a lazy slacker.”

“So you're not going to help reverse this?” you ask, starting to panic.

“I don't know how,” Zoe retorts. “So I'm just going to make the best of a bad situation. You wanted my life? Well, now you're stuck with it. Get used to wearing skirts and dresses. As far as I'm concerned, you're now Zoe, I'm now Kyle, and we have nothing in common.”

“But …”

“Goodbye, Zoe.”

You watch glumly as Zoe, dressed in your clothes, stomps off angrily down the school corridors, headed towards your old locker.

Looks like, for better or for worse, you're at least temporarily stuck pretending to be Zoe, as the real Zoe isn't going to help you any.
15111112.title: Stuck with Zoe's life

choices: Nothing. They think you've always had this body.
They're shocked and surprised to find a girl in their son's bedroom!
15112.content:
The alarm went off the next morning, as usual.

Grumbling, you rolled out of bed and stumbled blindly a few feet towards where the buzzing clock sat atop your dresser. Stretching your arm up towards the top of the dresser, you groping about bleary-eyed for a moment before finally switching off the alarm.

Then an odd realization suddenly hit you.

You shouldn't have to reach up to switch off the alarm.

Blinking the sleep from your eyes, you look around your bedroom. Everything is the same … yet different. The room seems slightly taller and wider.

Or have you suddenly become shorter?

With a gasp of panic, you look down at yourself. You're still wearing the same gray t-shirt and blue, plaid boxer shorts you went to bed in, but now, you're practically swimming in them. Something happened to you last night, and you've shrunk!

“Shit!” you grumble, stomping your foot on the floor.

That's when you notice your feet.

Not only are they smaller, but they're completely hairless. Not just your feet, but your now slender legs are shaved smooth. What's more, your toenails are painted glossy black now … and so are your fingernails!

“What the hell is going on?” you whisper in a panic.

Stumbling over to your mirror, you finally catch a glimpse of yourself.

You now have the body of Zoe Featherstone -- a pale, blue eyed, raven haired goth chick from school.

“Wait,” you whisper to yourself, now remembering the events of last night. “I wished I had Zoe's life. And now, I've turned into her!”

Just then, you hear the doorknob to your bedroom door begin to turn. You have only enough time to feel panic rising throughout your tiny, petite body. What will your parents say when they see what's happened to you?
15112.title: Your Life, Zoe's Body

choices: Your life at school is mostly the same as before.
Your life at school is full of strange, new surprises!
151121.content:
“Kyle?” asks your mother, gently opening your bedroom door.

You feel panic begin to rise into your throat, as your tiny heart begins pounding wildly now. What will she say when she sees you've changed into a girl overnight?

“Kyle, get dressed,” she says looking right at you. “Honestly, why do we have to go through this routine every day? You know the routine, young lady. You know when school starts. And you know the consequences for being late. Now get dressed, grab some breakfast while you still can, and let's get out the door on time for a change!”

With that, she firmly shuts the door with the familiar, soft slam that says she means business.

“Did she just call me a young lady?” you wonder aloud.

Instantly, you're disgusted with the high pitched, slightly nasal voice of Zoe Featherstone coming from your mouth. Unfortunately, there's nothing you can do about that at the moment. Strange as it seems, your stupid, idle wish from last night was somehow magically granted: you now inhabit Zoe's body, while still somehow living the life of Kyle Drake. And you still have a reputation, it seems, for being chronically late for school.

Pulling off your boxer shorts and t-shirt, you quickly grab some fresh clothes to wear. It seems bizarre that none of your clothes have changed. Your dresser is still full of the same t-shirts and jeans as always. And thankfully, it seems you still wear boxer shorts instead of panties. But you suppose a girl named “Kyle” would likely be a bit of a tomboy.

Then you notice the first major change to your new life (aside from your new, female body itself) … your underwear drawer now has boxer shorts and bras!

“I have to wear a bra?” you say in Zoe's slightly whiny voice.

Looking down at your currently nude body, you can easily see the answer to your question: two small, firm orbs of female flesh are dangling from your chest. Without a bra to restrain them, your boobs will be jiggling and bouncing all over the place today.

“Great,” you mutter, pulling on a small, white bra with a bit of lacy trim. “I can't wait to see what else has changed in my life.”

The rest of your clothes are the same as always: boxers, jeans, t-shirt, a pair of unisex socks, and your comfortable old sneakers.

You pose awkwardly in the mirror for a moment. The reflection is of a slender, pale skinned, dark haired teenage girl … apparently dressed in the oversized clothes of her older brother.
151121.title: Mom thinks this is normal

choices: Ask Austin if he's seen Zoe yet this morning?
1511211.content:
So you get to school okay. It feels bizarrely strange to be inhabiting the body of that weird Zoe girl. But your family all still called you "Kyle" this morning and treated you like you were just a female version of yourself. Hopefully school turns out the same, right?

As you get to school, your best friend Austin greets you.

"Hey, Kyle. Sup?" he says.

"Nothing, I guess," you answer with a mumble.

"What do you want to do after school today?" asks Austin.

"Is there anything different about me today?" you blurt out.

Austin rolls his eyes at you.

"Aw, come on, man!" he says. "Don't start being a chick on me all of a sudden!"

"Huh?" you ask. "What do you mean?"

"All that chick stuff that the other girls all do," replies Austin. "You know the routine: is there anything different about me? Don't you like my new hairstyle, or my new lipstick, or my new shoes, or my new blah-blah-blah, who cares!"

"That isn't quite what I meant," you answer.

"I hope not!" says Austin. "The only reason we've always been best friends is because you're not like all the other girls. You don't dress or act like a chick. You're just one of the dudes. So please don't tell me I'm losing my best friend because suddenly she decided she likes wearing dresses and getting her hair all dolled-up or something stupid."

"No way!" you protest. "Believe me, Austin: I've got no interest in wearing dresses or doing anything remotely feminine."

"Good," he laughs.

"I just meant, seriously: do I seem different today?" you ask. "I'm not fishing for compliments or anything of that girly crap. I just don't feel like myself today. And I need the honest opinion of someone who knows me – is there anything weird or different about me?"

Austin looks at you from head to toe before replying.

"Nope," he says with a grin. "You're the same girl I've always known. Now knock off this stupid stuff, will you?"

"Fine," you answer glumly.

It looks like your life is still the exact same – with the one minor difference that you now inhabit the body of Zoe Featherstone.

So what now?
1511211.title: Your life at school is mostly the same as before.

choices: Go to the girls bathroom and start wishing or praying to change back!
Try to find the original Zoe. Maybe she knows about magic and the occult?
1511212.content:
The trip to school proves uneventful.

Your mother, obsessed with making sure you're not late again, insists on personally driving you to school.

How embarrassing, you think. It's bad enough you're stuck with the body of a teenage girl now, but you have to get dropped off at school by your mommy? Normally, you'd walk to school, meeting up with a bunch of your friends on the way. Sure, you guys goof off a bit and take your sweet time getting there … but life is short! Why always be in such a rush?

“Have a good day, sweetie!” says your mom, kissing you on the forehead as you exit the car. “Try to pay attention in class today. This evening, we'll discuss what you need to do to catch up with your studies and homework.”

Crap, you think. Even in this weird new reality, you're a loser slacker with shitty grades. So what changed by wishing you had Zoe's life? You've got a chick's body, but everything else is the same miserable life you had before.

“Hey, babe,” says a familiar voice.

As your mom's car drives away, you slowly turn around and find yourself face-to-face with your best friend Austin.

Only he doesn't look like a “friend” anymore.

In fact, he's giving you a look that's a lot more than just friendly at the moment.

“Hi, Austin,” you say, suddenly nervous about what's going to happen next.

He kisses you.

Sloppily, and on the lips.

You're too shocked to pull away, and just stand there numb while your best friend shoves his tongue in your mouth.

“You okay, babe?” he says, finally withdrawing.

“Yeah,” you say. “I just don't feel myself right now.”

“It's cool,” Austin answers, wrapping an arm around your slender waist and walking you up into the school building. “We'll cut class together third period, meet out in the equipment shed, and relax.”

“Relax?” you ask.

“A li'l weed and what-you-need,” Austin says, winking at you.

Shit, you think. This is horrible! Because of one, stupid, backwards wish, you're now the girlfriend of your best buddy Austin. This isn't at all what you wanted when you made that stupid wish.

Think, think, think, you tell yourself. You've got until third period to come up with something, or Austin is going to expect you in the shed for a make-out session!
1511212.title: Kyle's new life at school

choices: Wish everything is back to normal
15112121.content:
You head to the girl's bathroom to wish/pray.

But do you try to wish/pray to return your body back to normal along with reality or do you make some adjustments to yoru wish in your current situation?
15112121.title: Go to the girls bathroom and start wishing or p...

151121211.content:
At first you feel nervous and frightened, being here in the girls bathroom. But a quick glance down at your adolescent breasts and thin, feminine frame rapidly reassures you that you're in the right place. As much as you'd feel more at home in the boy's locker, you are currently female and would make quite a scene anywhere else.

You look in the mirror at the scared, confused face of Zoe Featherstone wearing your clothes.

“That's me,” you glumly tell your feminine reflection.

What to do? This isn't what you wished for. Of course, you don't really want what you literally wished for anyhow. You don't want to become Zoe and live the rest of your days as a goth girl! But you also never wanted to wind up with Zoe's body in some weird, girly version of your own dismal life.

What's happening to you?

“I just wish everything was back to normal,” you say, fighting back the hot, salty tears beginning to well behind your eyes.
151121211.title: Wishes are Unpredictable Things

choices: Your wish is instantly granted. Somehow, you've acquired magic powers!
You stay in this body, but your life now becomes more like Zoe's.
1511212111.title: Something unexpected happens.

choices: A strange, magical entity appears, ready to try granting your latest wish.
You get a whole new body, PLUS your life undergoes a few new changes.
1511212112.title: Somethings incredibly weird happens!

choices: To actually have Zoe's life and not just her body
151121212.content: So what do you wish/pray for?
151121212.title: Make adjustments to your wish

choices: Gives you Zoe's life you asked for
1511212121.content: So does the wish give you Zoe's life or does something else happen?
1511212121.title: To actually have Zoe's life and not just he...

choices: You bestfriend is now Zoe's Boyfriend
15112121211.content:
The effects of the wish is quick and your clothes change to the style of a goth girl. It seems you also have a purse as well.

So you are pretty much getting the full treatment of having Zoe's life, body and all.

But is your bestfriend now the boyfriend of Zoe (to You) or do you just check out Zoe's life?
15112121211.title: Gives you Zoe's life you asked for

choices: Yes! You've always wanted to be Zoe and are 100% happy this way.
No, this isn't right. Something weird is happening to your mind.
151121212111.content:
For some strange reason, once you get into the girls bathroom you suddenly find yourself changing your mind about everything.

Just a moment ago, you hated the thought of being a girl and dating your best friend Austin.

But now that you're alone in the girls bathroom, a strange new sensation sweeps across you and you find yourself utterly a new wish out loud:

“I wish I actually had Zoe's life and not just her body,” you find yourself saying.

Somehow, your wish is instantaneously granted by whatever mysterious, magical powers-that-be who have been watching over you.

You are still in the same pale, skinny, female body that only moments ago you had been freaking out about inhabiting. But now, all of your old Kyle clothes are gone. You're dressed in an oversized black sweater, a pair of black and white striped tights, a long flowing black skirt, and Zoe Featherstone's favorite chunky heeled, black combat boots. Additionally, a small black purse is now slung over your shoulder.

“What's happening to me?” you mutter in Zoe's voice.

A moment earlier, this would have been the last thing in the world you wanted. To be Zoe, completely in body, life, and everything.

“I'm Zoe?” you ask your reflection.

Somehow it seems to echo back the answer: “I'm Zoe!”

“This is who I want to be,” you find yourself saying. “But is Austin still my boyfriend?”

Suddenly, this thought consumes you as the most important question in the world. You rush out of the bathroom, down the school corridors, and to your locker. Without the slightly fumbling, you easily spin the combination and open the locker.

Sighing with relief, you gaze at a myriad of photos of you and Austin together, the pictures now all plastered over the interior walls of your locker.

“I'm still Austin's girlfriend,” you think happily.

But wait a minute … didn't you want to undo all of this just a few moments earlier?

No, that can't be right.

You've always wanted to be a goth girl … haven't you?
151121212111.title: A Conundrum

choices: Your wish does not work at all
15112121212.content: Does the wish not work at all or did something else happen?
15112121212.title: something else

choices: Yes, your new female life, plus some better things
1511212122.content:
Maybe you are too hasty with disliking the idea that you are now you bestfriend's girlfriend in the new reality. It might not be a bad thing and possible you two like doing the same sort of things.

So do you wish that you are the female version of yourself and that you are not late alot nor have failing grades and your friend is not into illegal stuff (like weed) and this is all be normal?
1511212122.title: Maybe having love in your life is not so bad...

choices: Your old body, now completely in drag, dolled up in the clothes of a goth girl.
Your old body, but dressed in male goth attire as a goth dude.
15112122.content:
“I gotta go,” you tell Austin.

He kisses you, just on the cheek this time. Again, you find yourself grimacing from the horror of having your best friend continually shove his face into your personal space.

“See you later, Kyle!” he says, then winks and walks off.

“I'm a girl named Kyle,” you mutter. “How fucked up is this?”

You figure the best route to take is to track down Zoe. Not only is she smart and probably well-versed in occult, paranormal shit … but since you've got her body right now, she's probably been affected by your stupid, idle wish. If she's stuck with your old male body, then it only stands to reason Zoe would bound to be highly motivated to figure out a way of undoing this whole mess!

It's still early morning, with students flittering about from their lockers to the vending machines. But soon the bell will ring and everyone will empty the corridors and head off to first period class. You've got to move fast if you're going to track down Zoe and have this urgent conversation with her.

Your smaller, lighter body moves with surprisingly fluid grace through the claustrophobically crowded high school halls. You actually feel lithe and energetic, compared to the normally somnambulistic blocky, stumbling you do in these corridors each morning. With Zoe's shorter and more dextrous body, you're easily able to weave through the milling throng of students and eventually find the hallway where you think Zoe's locker is.

She should be here, you muse while scanning the crowd of chattering teens.

Although, you remind yourself, you should be looking for a boy who looks an awful lot like Kyle Drake. If you were looking for Zoe's body, all you really have to do is look down at yourself now!

Again, you start sifting through the crowd, this time searching for your own face.

What do you find?
15112122.title: Try to find the original Zoe

choices: The new Zoe confronts you first about the changes
Another reality change: Zoe is your new best friend
151121221.content:
It doesn't take you too long to find the Kyle Drake/Zoe Featherstone conglomeration. While navigating the English hall you hear a murmur spread throughout the hall. Students draw back from the center of the passageway and form clusters, whispering in each other's ears with cupped hands as a figure emerges from the staircase connecting English with mathematics. Each step the person takes rings with a dozen clattering keychains.

"Oh my God..." you say aloud. Your limbs feel weak.

Walking down the hall, head stooped in mock-apathy, is your old body, the tall, lanky high school boy with the "dweeby" brown hair, now done up in black with violet, green and blue streaks mixed into a chaotic design. You were expecting as much, along with a leather jacket, studs, baggy black pants and boots, all the hallmarks of the high school goth. Fate decided to throw you for a loop. You stare at the new "Kyle's" candy cane stockings, stretching up from and out of his purple Wicked Witch of the West high heels. Where the stockings end an eggplant-colored skirt begins, clearly stitched back together to give it that hand-done, DIY look, and as it swishes the twenty or so keychains lining it - depressed-looking Hello Kitties, monkeys with skull faces, anime characters, umbrellas, odd mementos of sad times never lived - started up a percussive cacophony. She wore no jacket or studs. There was only the strappy, ashen tank top with the bra straps visible, showing off your body's new paler skin. You can't even bear to look at your face. It's wearing more eyeliner than Marilyn Manson!

Your old body adopted Zoe's goth fashion, all right, more literally than you could imagine. Now he's the laughing stock of the school! By contrast, your grumpy tomboyishness and crappy grades seem like the best life ever... But it's still a life you don't want to live.
151121221.title: Goth dude looks like a lady

choices: Cut class and help Zoe think of ways to undo this mess.
Get to class! You're in enough trouble already. Brainstorming can wait.
1511212211.content:
The new, male Zoe immediately spots you standing at the base of the stairs. You think for a moment to run and hide, but there's no point. You were looking for her after all. You simply didn't expect to find THIS.

“Good morning, Kyle,” she says to you icily. It's surreal hearing your old, masculine voice coming from those lips, painted with a heavy coating of glossy, black lipstick.

“Hi Zoe,” you manage to reply weakly. “I think we should talk. Maybe someplace more private?”

You hear a stream of whispered gossip and innuendo emanating from the milling crowd of kids gawking at your old body, now dolled up as a goth drag queen.

“Follow me,” Zoe says gruffly.

Grabbing your smaller, feminine arm, Zoe roughly pulls you through the school corridor, around a corner, and into an unlocked utility closet used for storage by the custodial staff. Slamming the door behind her, Zoe released her grip on your arm and demanded answers.

“What's going on?” she asks flatly. “Why do you have my body, and why am I stuck as a drag queen version of you?”

“I made a stupid wish last night,” you find yourself confessing.

“You wished I was a sweet transvestite from transsexual Transylvania?” asks Zoe, the volume of her baritone voice rising with irritation.

“No,” you start to say.

“You wished you were a tomboy pot head chick version of yourself, except with my body?” asks Zoe sarcastically.

“No,” you try to explain. “Look, I just said a dumb thing. Here's the whole deal: I wished that I had your life. It was just the first thing that popped into my head. Look, I'd had a miserable day. I'm such a loser, I get shitty grades at school, my parents hate me, I'm always getting chewed out by everybody. I was jealous of your life. Everything is easy for you. People like you, and you get good grades. I wished I had your life. That's all.”

Zoe was silent for a moment. You try to search her eyes for meaning. She's just stony faced though.

“You think everything is easy for me?” she finally says, in a surprisingly quiet voice. “Kyle, I work very hard for everything that I've achieved. And believe me, when you're part of the goth subculture, it's twice as hard to please teachers and parents. That's why I work so hard and keep my nose clean. Adults take one look at the way I dress, and they assume I'm a troublemaker.”

“I'm sorry,” you say. “Like I said before, it was a dumb wish. I never really thought it would come true. And I really am sorry. None of this is what I wanted. I didn't mean to ruin your life, Zoe. I guess you and I ran in different paths. We never really knew one another. I didn't know how things were for you.”

“Water under the bridge,” Zoe answers brusquely. “Let's move on. We've got a problem to deal with here, because what you wished for did not come true.”

“Huh?”

“Look at us Kyle,” continues Zoe. “You wished for my life, right? Instead, you got my body and I got your body. But my parents still called me Zoe this morning. They think I'm their transgender son, who goes by the name Zoe and wants to undergo sex reassignment surgery once I'm old enough. Did you know, they've got your old body on hormone therapy now? Reality has changed so that everyone thinks I'm a girl trapped in a boy's body.”

“Well you are,” you point out.

“Not the way they think,” Zoe replies, with a weak laugh. “Kyle, it was bad enough for me to get through life being a goth girl. Now I have to go through life as a transgender, teenage boy taking female hormones.”

“Sorry,” you mutter.

“I'm guessing you're none too happy with your situation either?” asks Zoe.

“I'm a girl named Kyle,” you say with a shrug. “Guess I'm a tomboy or something. I'm a stoner chick, too. Still a big screw up at home and school. Oh, and I'm the girlfriend of my best friend Austin now. So, yeah, I'm not too happy about this.”

You anxiously fidget a bit, adjusting the still unfamiliar weight of Zoe's modest breasts, now attached to your chest.

“Let's put our heads together and figure out how to change back,” Zoe says.

“Shouldn't we get to class?” you ask nervously.

“You're not listening to me, Kyle,” sighs an exasperated Zoe. “You want to go live your new life as a girl named Kyle? Go ahead. I'm cutting class today to brainstorm and come up with some suggestions to undo this nightmare you've inflicted on us. You can either join me, or go get stoned with your new boyfriend.”
1511212211.title: Zoe confronts you

choices: You go to your first class, hoping female Kyle has the same schedule
Zoe makes an errant, bitter wish on you - and it comes true!
15112122112.content:
"In case you forgot," you interject, "My wish didn't give me a better life. I'm still the lazy, class screw-up I always was even if I now have boobs!"

Zoe crossed her arms tightly enough to emphasize her now flat chest. "Are you implying you expected my breasts to improve your intelligence?"

You squirm. The diplomatic attempt to weasel your way out of skipping class failed, and now the only person on your side has taken offense at your careless comment. In what may be a perfect demonstration of Murphy's Law, the school bell chooses to chime in at that moment and resonate its eerie, steel shriek against every wall, locker and classroom, crisply audible even inside the closet. Students heads, which floated past the door window every now and then before, now flicker by in every direction, unceasing, and you swear a few see you through the grimy glass and slow down. You can't afford any more cracks in your reputation!

Your mouth moves double time: "What I'm saying is I got chewed out by my mom this morning, and I'm sure if I'm not in class she will be the first to hear about from my teacher, the principal, whoever, on the phone, and no amount of wishing, magic, voodoo, hexes or God-granted miracles will save me from the unholy wrath of Mrs. Drake. I'm not going to get stoned; I won't let Austin shove his tongue down my throat. But I'm going to class, and I will meet you before Austin finds me at lunchtime."

Having said that, you hesitate in leaving the closet, blowing your cover and proving to the whole school - in their minds at least - that Tim Curry's apprentice has li'l tomboy Kyle under his/her belt in more ways than one. At the same time you refuse to look at Zoe for fear of what judgment her face will convey. It takes an ample amount of courage and an extraordinary level of rationalization (you'll disappear into the flux of English hall students; nobody will catch anything suspicious if you move quickly), you exit the closet and make your way to class. If Zoe can work hard to break her image, so will you. Hopefully she understands that involves minimizing contact between the two of you...
15112122112.title: Keeping your own nose clean

choices: Thank goodness, you still have US History!
Shoot! You're supposed to be in another class... but which?
151121221121.content: You scamper through the halls, glad you kept your old fashion in the transformation. Had you woken up to find only thin-toed high heels and swarthy combat boots this might have been the most excruciating run in your short life's history. A clock on the wall explains, gentle but sternly, you have three minutes to cross the breadth of campus to your US History class before you are late. You actually enjoy social studies, even if you never hand in homework, the lectures bore you to sleep, and while you brown-nose them, compliment them, and plead for paper extensions from them, every teacher has written you off as failure. Certainly history doesn't hurt your brain as much as Cartesian graphs and the periodic table. It's a good class to start this mad, screwball, very unscientific day with... assuming your schedule hasn't changed with your body.
151121221121.title: Mad school dash

choices: Spend today working hard to change your life for the better.
That can wait for another day! You've endured too many changes already.
1511212211211.content:
Dashing through the almost empty school corridors, you narrowly make it into your US History classroom just as the final bell begins to sound.

Mr. Erskine, a shaggy haired teacher with thick, horned-rim glasses, looks up from his desk and grins at you, standing in the doorway panting to catch your breath.

“Almost didn't make it that time, Miss Drake!” he chuckled. “Take your seat, and we'll get started.”

Good old Mr. Erskine, you think.

Where a lot of the school's faculty are royal jerks, Mr. Erskine is actually pretty cool for a dorky, middle-aged teacher. Sure, he's always nagging you to turn in assignments on-time and study harder for tests. But Mr. Erskine seemed to actually care about how his students were doing. Some of the teachers here viewed their jobs more like being wardens of juvenile prison. Absolute discipline and adherence to all the technical details of the school's rules and regulations seemed more important to them than actually taking the time to make sure kids were learning something.

As you settled into your seat, Mr. Erskine started his lecture. Normally, you zone at this point. But today, things are different.

Glancing down at your breasts and the smooth area of your crotch reinforcing just how different today is!

But it's more than just that.

Unlike a lot of your teachers, Mr. Erskine never seemed to totally write you off as a failure. Sure, he bugged you all the time about paying attention, doing your homework, and studying for tests. But, out of all your teachers, he never gave up and just assumed you're a loser.

And you found yourself thinking more and more about Zoe and what she'd just told you. How she's had to work twice as hard as anyone else at school, just to overcome all the prejudices people have about weird, goth chicks. Zoe never gave up on herself, though. Somehow, she managed to get straight A's. And you were pretty sure there are multiple teachers here who secretly dislike Zoe just because of the way she dresses. They'd love to see her fail. Probably a lot of the kids at school would too.

Hell, you think, Zoe is probably even more of a social outcast now that she's been changed into a pre-op transsexual.

And yet Zoe still hasn't given up. Presumably she's cutting class right now, just like she said she would, to go brainstorm for ways of reversing all the insane, screwball effects your idle wish had wrought upon the two of you.

Maybe you should have wished for Zoe's work ethic and perseverance instead of her life.

Was there hope for you to turn things around in your own life? Maybe today is just some cosmic wake-up call for you to straighten up and fly right? After all, if this was the plot of some Hollywood movie, you and Zoe would both learn some valuable life lessons and then magically discover everything is back to normal.

Maybe that's what you should do?
1511212211211.title: History Lessons

choices: You head off to your Remedial Social Studies class.
Mr. Erskine wants you to take a drug test now!
1511212211212.content:
You dash around the corner and scamper into your US History class just as the bell starts to sound its piercing shrill alarm.

Some of your teachers are real jerks and will count you tardy if your not physically seated in your desk when the final bell rings. Fortunately your US History teacher, Mr. Erskine, is far more forgiving. That's probably one of the reasons you actually enjoy his class, even if you never bother to turn in assignments on time.

But as you pause to catch your breath after running through the halls, you notice something different about Mr. Erksine's class today: some strange girl is sitting at your desk.

You frown at her and start to say something, but Mr. Erskine looks up and notices you at this moment. He speaks before you even have the chance.

“Miss Drake, can we help you with something?” says Mr. Erskine.

Ouch, you think, wincing a bit. It sucks being called 'Miss Drake,' but technically that's who you are right now.

“I'm, uh, here for class,” you mumble, brushing a long strand of hair from your face.

“Not this one you aren't,” answers Mr. Erksine.

15113211.content:
“Why are you me?” Zoe asks in a surprisingly calm, matter of fact manner.

“I'm you?” you echo helplessly.

“Who are you?” Zoe asks. “And what's going on? Hmm, there are two beds in here now. And it looks like my dresser just gave birth to a clone of itself. So there's two of us, then. You're not me, but you are … what? My new twin sister?”

“I guess,” you shrug.

“You're a bit slow on the uptake though, aren't you?” continued Zoe. “You still haven't answered any of my questions. Am I just talking to myself here, reasoning and speculating to no one in particular? Who are you?”

“I'm Kyle Drake,” you confess.

The words sound utterly bizarre coming out with the sound of Zoe's voice.

“Kyle?” Zoe says, finally looking surprised for the first time. She cracks a smile and actually chuckles a bit. “You're a guy? That Kyle guy from school? How did … why are … what are you …”

“Now who's slow on the uptake?” you mutter.

“Fair enough,” laughs Zoe. “But in my defense, you just took a Twilight Zone episode and made it something out of Twin Peaks.”

“Huh?” you say, not really getting Zoe's somewhat obscure reference.

“Never mind,” she says, clearly accustomed to people often failing to appreciate her quirky eccentricities. “The real question is, how and why did Kyle Drake get turned into my identical twin sister?”

“Zoe, Kylie, get up girls!” cries out a woman's voice from beyond the closed bedroom door and somewhere down the hall.

“Kylie?” Zoe says. “So it seems Kyle Drake has now become, what – Kylie Featherstone, my lovely twin sister?”

“Look, I made a stupid wish last night that …” you start to say.

“Hush, my dear sister. Explanations can wait,” says Zoe. “We'd better get dressed for school. You're about to discover that your new mom can be quite the demanding task master! Welcome to your new family, Kylie. I, uh, think the dresser on the left is probably yours. Let's get dressed quickly.”

“I told you, the dresser on the left is probably yours,” says Zoe, stripping out of her night clothes and standing nude in front of you, like it's no big deal at all. “I recognize all the junk of the top of this dresser, so it's probably mine. The stuff cluttered on the left dresser doesn't look familiar. Ergo, that one is bound to be yours. Elementary logic, my dear sister.”

You're still trying to blink the sleep from your eyes and somehow wrap your mind around the bizarre strangeness of waking up in a stranger's body, and here Zoe is casually strutting around in front of you naked and calmly making logical deductions.

“Get dressed, dear sister,” Zoe says to you again, as she digs through her own dresser drawers and starts pulling out panties and a bra to wear. “Your new mother will not tolerate tardiness. Move, move, move!”

Unsure what else to do, you slowly begin removing the flimsy camisole and lacy panties you woke up in. Although you and Zoe are both physically female at the moment (not to mention sisters now), you still feel the need to avert your eyes from her nudity. In fact you blush even at your own nudity, realizing that your body is now a perfect cloned copy of Zoe's.

“So you were saying something about a stupid wish?” asked Zoe, sliding on her panties and fastening her bra.

“Uh, yeah, so, um,” you say, shaking your head to clear away the picture of the attractive, half-naked goth girl next to you. “Anyhow, I had a really bad day yesterday. I won't go into all the details, but it was the king of all rotten days. Everything I touched went wrong. So before bed last night, I made this stupid, dumb wish …”

“That you were Zoe Featherstone's twin sister?” grinned Zoe.

“No,” you reply flatly. “I wished that I had your life.”

“Why?” laughed Zoe.

“I don't know,” you answer with a shrug. “I never thought the wish would really come true. And anyhow, you've got it made. You get good grades, people all seem to like you, and yet you're still a really unique person. You don't blend into a crowd, Zoe. You're not afraid to be yourself, dress all goth like, and live life on your own terms. And somehow you make it work. You're successful at school and stuff, without ever selling out and being someone you're not.”

“Awww, Kyle,” Zoe says, pausing and blushing. “That's really sweet. If you weren't my sister – not to mention naked at the moment – I'd give you a hug!”

“Well …” you shrug with embarrassment, twisting your foot into the carpet bashfully.

“My life is far from perfect,” Zoe continues. “As I'm sure you're about to discover! I wish I would have known all this about you yesterday, though. Maybe you and I could have gotten to know one another under different circumstances, and you might never have made that ill-advised wish.”

“Yeah, do you know of any way I can undo that wish?” you ask. “I'm not really looking forward to being a girl from now.”

“I can tell,” laughs Zoe. “You're still standing there naked and shivering. Are you that afraid to open your dresser and put on your bra and panties, Kyle? Come on! Your wish clearly altered reality and rewrote history. Those are your clothes now, sweetie. And that's your mother downstairs getting irritated and impatient with us girls for being so slow in getting ready today. So get over your hang-ups and get dressed.”

“But, it's just that I …”

“Get dressed!” commands Zoe in a playful yet firm tone of voice. “We'll talk later at school about your wish, the consequences of it, and whether or not there's any possibility of you ever regaining your old male life as Kyle Drake.”

Sighing, you take a hesitant step towards your new dresser and open a drawer, revealing its contents.

You are suddenly transported to a fancy, upscale salon. In one hand you are holding a nail file and in the other a woman's hand.

"Huh?" Is the only thing you could muster. It was a jarring experience going your bed to the salon in an instant.

"Are you okay ma’am?" Your eyes follow the hand up to the woman who spoke to you. She has a concerned look on her face.

"Umm. I'll be right back." You set the nail file down and stand up. You start to wobble as you walk and you look down. You are wearing wedge heels. Why am I wearing those? You steady yourself and search for a bathroom to hide in. You find a single stall unisex bathroom and you lock it behind you. "Where the hell am I? This has to be a dream." You think as you rub your head. --Hair?! Your hands instinctually yank at the strands of brown hair. You wince.

You walk in front of the mirror that is hanging above the bathroom sink, hoping that your reflection will answer some questions. You aren't prepared for what you see. It isn't even your reflection that stares back at you. "Lexi?" Your confused voice asks her. She doesn't say anything so you ask again. You notice that her mouth moves when you speak. It takes you a few seconds to realize that you have her reflection. Lexi's chestnut hair is styled a 1960s bob. You reach up and touch your hair. You silkiness of your hair confirms that you have the same hair. You look down at yourself. You are still yourself, but your clothing is different now. You are wearing a light grey v neck. A small necklace rests on your chest. You can feel the restrictiveness of a bra underneath the shirt. Your legs are clad in a pair of white skinny jeans. You can't tell what kind of underwear you are wearing, but it is definitely not your boxers. On your feet are the same wedge heels you first saw. You had cross-dressed in the past, but these clothes are different. They feel custom fitted to your body.

You are startled but a knock on the bathroom door. "Lexi are you okay?" You open the door and a girl is standing there. You notice her name tag and assume she is an employee too.

"Err. I’m sorry Nicole." You apologize. She looks at you with pity in her eyes.

"Listen, I know it’s been hard since your parents kicked you out. Why don't you head back to the apartment and I'll finish up here." You aren't sure what to say so you simply nod. "Okay, let's go back to the break room and get you clocked out for the day." You follow Nicole through the salon and to the employee break room. The small room has a few lockers on the wall. You see one with Lexi's name on it. You open it and find a purse. You grab it and try to casually sling it over your shoulder.

"Thank you so much Nicole." You say as you close the locker door.

"Don't worry about it. I'll see you at home in a couple of hours." So Nicole and Lexi must be roommates you think as you leave the salon.

"Now what? I don't even know what kind of car Lexi drives, let alone where she lives." You reach into her purse and dig around for her keys. Bah it's a mess in here. You find the keys and luckily it has horn on it so you can locate the car. You press the button and a white sedan honks nearby. You open the car door and throw the purse into the passenger seat. A GPS is plugged into the dash board. I hope her apartment address is in there. You turn the car on and the GPS turns on with it. You search for recent destination and find an address that looks promising. You pull out of the salon parking lot and follow the GPS' directions.

It is a short drive and you quickly are outside of an apartment complex. You turn off the car and look at her keys. "Maybe her room number is on her keys." You find a key that says 224C. "That must be it." You grab the purse and walk into the apartment. It takes a few minutes to understand the layout of the apartment building, but you find the room that matches your keys. You insert the keys into the lock and open the door.

"Home sweet home." You say as you shut the door behind you. The small apartment looks quite comfortable. There is a small kitchen, a living room, and 2 bedrooms. As you walk through the room, a small white kitten rubs against your leg. "Well hello there!" You say to the small kitten as you pick him up. He purrs happily in your arms. You place him back down on the ground and head towards the bedrooms. He follows closely behind you. Not knowing which bedroom was Lexi's you check the room on the right. It is spotless and smells like lilacs. As you explore the room you are relieved to see that it is Lexi's room. You lie down on her bed and exhale. In the course of an hour you had somehow switches lives with one of your old friends, left her work, and come to her apartment. All of it seemed like a blur. You still aren't sure if this is all really happening or if you are dreaming.

As you laid there you started to think. What happened to the real Lexi? Was she in your life right now? You reached for Lexi's cellphone and you dial your own phone number. After a few rings someone picks up.

"Hello?" Says a female voice.

"Umm...Lexi?" You hesitantly say.

"No this is Kyle Drake. Who is this?" Does she think that she is me now?

"Oh sorry this is Alexis Jacobson." You say back to her.

"Oh wow that is weird, I thinking about your earlier today Lexi! How are you doing?" She casually talks with you. You spend a few minutes trying to answer her questions. "Anyways, we should hang out sometime Lexi." She finishes and hangs up.
